diagnoses.name: Infective Endocarditis

signs_any: New murmur or changing regurgitant murmur
Janeway lesions, Osler nodes, Roth spots

initial_tests: Echo (TTE initial, TEE more sensitive for vegetations/abscess)

empiric: IV vancomycin ± cefepime until cultures available
definitive: Targeted IV antibiotics for 4–6 weeks based on organism
Surgery if heart failure, uncontrolled infection, large vegetations with emboli, abscess

anticoagulation: Avoid starting anticoagulation in acute IE with CNS emboli (risk of hemorrhage)

follow_up: Monitor renal function, drug levels (aminoglycosides, vancomycin)

instructions: Adherence to prolonged IV antibiotic therapy (often via PICC)
Dental hygiene to reduce recurrence risk

diagnoses.name: Rheumatic Heart Disease

signs_any: New murmur of MR or MS

initial_tests: Throat culture or rapid strep test (initial infection)
Jones Criteria for diagnosis (2 major or 1 major + 2 minor)

acute: Penicillin (or erythromycin if allergic) for GAS eradication
long_term: Secondary prophylaxis with IM benzathine penicillin every 3–4 weeks (duration depends on severity, often 10+ years)
Valve repair/replacement for severe chronic MR/MS

follow_up: Monitor for progression to valvular disease (esp. MS, MR)

instructions: Report new dyspnea, palpitations, or edema
follow_up: Cardiology follow-up; infectious disease if recurrent strep
